history.title: History
history.caption: Created to be the pinnacle of New York dining and nightlife, the history of the Rainbow Room is as dazzling as the city lights that surround it.

cards.title: Aug. 22, 1934
cards.caption: The New York Times headline announced “Nightclub to open atop RCA Building.” The article went on to report, “The dining room two stories high, will be known as the ‘Stratosphere’ and will open with an extensive array of entertainment.”

image.alt: Private event with live music and dance at Rainbow Room in August 1934.

cards.title: Sept. 14, 1934
cards.caption: The opening of the Rainbow Room was officially announced. The name was changed from “Stratosphere” because, according to The New Yorker, “the Rockefellers decided that it (the name) ... sounded too much like an ordinary nightclub.”

image.alt: Rainbow Room high dining on the Rockefeller Center roof card from 1934.

cards.title: July 26, 1938
cards.caption: The Rainbow Room offers salmon for dinner that was caught on Canada’s Gaspe Peninsula in the morning, shipped, and served that night––a New York first.

image.alt: Busy chefs cooking in the Rainbow Room kitchen in July 1938.

cards.title: Dec. 31, 1942-Oct. 10, 1950
cards.caption: Following Pearl Harbor, as the nation’s energies went into the war effort, the dancing at the Rainbow Room stopped and its restaurant closed. In the image above, Mayor F.H. LaGuardia tests out the new super-siren on the Rockefeller Center Observation Deck in preparation for wartime emergencies.

image.alt: The Victory Siren getting installed at the top of the RCA building in Rockefeller Center in 1942.

cards.didYouKnow: May 12, 1964. The Rainbow Room hosts the opening-night party for the cast and crew of Funny Girl, starring the 21-year-old Barbra Streisand.

cards.title: Nov. 16, 1965
cards.caption: Le Cercle d'Or presents The Mod Ball at the Rainbow Room. In attendance were the King Bees, the Losers, the Rainmakers, the Tyree Glenn, Jrs., the Berets, and the Toys, as well as Andy Warhol.

image.alt: Poster of the MOD Ball at the Rainbow Room in November 1965.

cards.caption: The newly-designed South Lounge of the Rainbow Room/Rainbow Grill featured an elevated dining area enhancing the sweeping skyline view of Manhattan. The renovations began on July 31, 1979 for completion in September of the same year.

image.alt: A sketch of a lively restaurant scene.

cards.title: Jan. 31, 1984
cards.caption: On this night, the Rainbow Room kicked off a year-long celebration of its 50th Year with the famed Woody Herman and His All Stars. This was the first of many gala events featuring the Big Band Sounds of the ‘30s and ‘40s.

image.alt: Sign prepared for the Rainblow Room's 50th Year celebration in January 1984.

cards.title: Dec. 9, 1987
cards.caption: The first night of a two-night black-tie gala bash marking the restoration and reopening of the Rainbow Room. The guest list on night #1 was said to have more glamour than the official opening on October 3, 1934. It included Brooke Astor, Judy and Samuel Peabody, James Nederlander, Donald Marron, John V. Lindsay, Barbara Walters, Michael and Diandre Douglas, Liza Minnelli, and Mikhail Baryshnikov.

image.alt: Mikhail Baryshnikov photographed at a NYC event in 1987.

cards.title: Feb. 1995
cards.caption: Dale DeGroff, the father of the cocktail renaissance, managed the Rainbow Room bar for 12 years, and orchestrated the first ever cocktail dinners where each course of the meal was complimented by a custom cocktail.

image.alt: Fruity martini with blueberry garnish.

cards.didYouKnow: It was at the Rainbow Room where the Cosmopolitan’s superstardom began. Its popularity skyrocketed when Madonna was pictured sipping one at the Rainbow Room Grammy party.

cards.caption: The Cipriani family assumes operation of the Rainbow Room. Prior to reopening in 2014, Rainbow Room was last open to the public as a nightclub on June 5, 2009 and a final brunch was served on Father’s Day, 2009.

image.alt: Neon sign outside NBC Studios, Rainbow Room, and Top of the Rock observation deck.

cards.title: Oct. 13, 2012
cards.caption: Rainbow Room is declared a New York City landmark by the New York Landmarks Commission.

image.alt: Detail of the largest of the three chandeliers in the Rainbow Room at Rock Center.

cards.title: Oct. 5, 2014
cards.caption: Rainbow Room reopens after undergoing a multi-million dollar renovation and restoration led by architect Michael Gabellini.

image.alt: Beautifully decorated Rainbow Room with the chandelier and dance floor, ready for a party.

cards.title: Feb. 9, 2019
cards.caption: Alexander Wang threw the party of the season with his Big Trouble in Little China(town) all-nighter.

image.alt: Chinese New Year celebration party at the Rainblow Room.
